pullrequest.title: Issue#100 wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
example world xacro:

```
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6" xmlns:xacro="http://ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <world name="wind_test">
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/sandisland.xacro" />
    <xacro:sandisland />
    <include>
      <uri>model://robotx_light_buoy</uri>
      <pose>58 68 2 0 0 0.4</pose>
    </include>
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/gazebo_wind_plugin.xacro"/>
    <xacro:usv_wind_gazebo direction="270"
                          mean_vel="10"
                          var_gain="100"
                          var_time="5" >
      <wind_objs>
        <wind_obj>
          <name>wamv</name>
          <link_name>base_link</link_name>
          <coeff_vector>0.5 0.5 0.33</coeff_vector>
        </wind_obj>
        <wind_obj>
          <name>robotx_light_buoy</name>
          <link_name>base_link</link_name>
          <coeff_vector>0.5 0.5 0.33</coeff_vector>
        </wind_obj>
      </wind_objs>
    </xacro:usv_wind_gazebo>
  </world>
</sdf>
```
content.html:
example world xacro:

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6" xmlns:xacro="http://ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <world name="wind_test">
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/sandisland.xacro" />
    <xacro:sandisland />
    <include>
      <uri>model://robotx_light_buoy</uri>
      <pose>58 68 2 0 0 0.4</pose>
    </include>
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/gazebo_wind_plugin.xacro"/>
    <xacro:usv_wind_gazebo direction="270"
                          mean_vel="10"
                          var_gain="100"
                          var_time="5" >
      <wind_objs>
        <wind_obj>
          <name>wamv</name>
          <link_name>base_link</link_name>
          <coeff_vector>0.5 0.5 0.33</coeff_vector>
        </wind_obj>
        <wind_obj>
          <name>robotx_light_buoy</name>
          <link_name>base_link</link_name>
          <coeff_vector>0.5 0.5 0.33</coeff_vector>
        </wind_obj>
      </wind_objs>
    </xacro:usv_wind_gazebo>
  </world>
</sdf>

pullrequest.title: Issue#100 wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
Can we use something like this instead?

```
<models>
  <model>
    <name>model_name_1</name>
    <link_name>link_name_1</link_name>
    <coeff_vector>...</coeff_vector>
  </model>
  ...
  <model>
    ...
  </model>
</models>
```

This way, we don't have to remember to update `models_n` if we add or remove models. Take a look at `usv_gazebo_plugins/src/usv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.cc` for an example.
content.html:
Can we use something like this instead?

<models>
  <model>
    <name>model_name_1</name>
    <link_name>link_name_1</link_name>
    <coeff_vector>...</coeff_vector>
  </model>
  ...
  <model>
    ...
  </model>
</models>

This way, we don't have to remember to update models_n if we add or remove models. Take a look at usv_gazebo_plugins/src/usv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.cc for an example.

pullrequest.title: Issue#100 wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
This works really well and will allow a lot of new functionality.  I would recommend considering:

* Adding the plugin to the sandisland.world.xacro file so that the wind is defined for the standards world.
* Adding a demonstration of the functionality by:

    * Adding a standalone example world similar to the one above - with two objects affected by wind.  \(I tried this and it was illustrative to make the coefficients for the light buoy negative so that USV and light buoy moved in opposite directions;\)
    * Add a short tutorial to explain running the demonstration - perhaps a new page under [#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters)
    * Edit the tutorial at [#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters) to be consistent with the new design.
    

A few comments below.

Otherwise looks good to me and ready to approve.
content.html:
This works really well and will allow a lot of new functionality. I would recommend considering:

  • Adding the plugin to the sandisland.world.xacro file so that the wind is defined for the standards world.

  • Adding a demonstration of the functionality by:

    • Adding a standalone example world similar to the one above - with two objects affected by wind. (I tried this and it was illustrative to make the coefficients for the light buoy negative so that USV and light buoy moved in opposite directions;)
    • Add a short tutorial to explain running the demonstration - perhaps a new page under #!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters
    • Edit the tutorial at #!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters to be consistent with the new design.

A few comments below.

Otherwise looks good to me and ready to approve.

pullrequest.title: Issue#100 wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
Hi Brian, thanks for checking out my PR!

I have added the wind xacro macro call for the wamv to sandisland.world.xacro to provide some default wind.

I also added the wind\_test.world to vrx\_gazebo for wind demonstration.

I am working on updating the wiki pages now.
content.html:
Hi Brian, thanks for checking out my PR!

I have added the wind xacro macro call for the wamv to sandisland.world.xacro to provide some default wind.

I also added the wind_test.world to vrx_gazebo for wind demonstration.

I am working on updating the wiki pages now.

pullrequest.title: Issue#100 wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw: Let's assume that we have two objects to initialize but the second is not ready yet. We mark the first object as initialized but `this->windObjsInit` is still false. A few updates later, the second object is ready and we mark it as initialized too. I think that `objs` will be equals to `1` , as it's only incremented when an object is uninitialized. Thus, `this->windObjsInit` will still be `false`.
content.html: Let's assume that we have two objects to initialize but the second is not ready yet. We mark the first object as initialized but this->windObjsInit is still false. A few updates later, the second object is ready and we mark it as initialized too. I think that objs will be equals to 1 , as it's only incremented when an object is uninitialized. Thus, this->windObjsInit will still be false.
